comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: LOC, note error in transcription "Galicia" "Albert Theodor Otto Emmich (since 1913 von Emmich) (April 4, 1848 – December 22, 1915) was a Prussian general." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Otto_von_Emmich (there is more detail in German Wikipedia: de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Otto_von_Emmich) In April, 1915, he was transferred to the Eastern Front for the major German offensive which began in May of that year. See also:

comment.author: 14651149@N00
comment._content: There's something strange going on with this train coach. Look at all of the cables coming out of the windows and heading up to the roof.

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content:
artolog: Thank you for the other image of Emmich, the additional details and for catching the typo in the title. We will update the description with the new information.

LWyman: You are right about the cables on top of the train.  Any ideas what could be going on?

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: When looking for idea as to what the cables on the train are, I found a great set of German postcards from 1914-1916: www.allworldwars.com/German-World-War-I-Postcards-Part-I.... Nothing showing the cables, but there is a picture of Emmich's funeral. The source of the postcards may be New York Public Library -- digitalgallery.nypl.org/nypldigital/dgkeysearchresult.cfm... -- but the site above has translated the captions and narrowed the date range.
